intro: Hieracium xanthoglaucodes, commonly known as the yellow-leaf hawkweed, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its bright yellow flowers and hairy, lobed leaves. Native to Europe and parts of Asia, it thrives in grassy and disturbed habitats. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces numerous small, dandelion-like flowers. It is often found in meadows, roadsides, and other open areas where it can spread readily.
